all_paragraphs: Learning a new skill by yourself is not easy.
Learning a new set of skills by yourself for a career is definitely not easy.
Self-learning is a commitment that requires focus, dedication, and most importantly, time.

If you’re reading this, I’m going to assume that there’s a good chance that at some point, you have heard Data Scientists being classified as the “Sexiest Job of The 21st Century”. You do a Google search and see various sources report that there is currently a shortage of Data Scientists and the demand will continue to rapidly grow. During your research, you discover the main thing that catches everyone’s attention, their salaries. While browsing the internet to find some of the prerequisites needed to become a Data Scientist, you start to notice a trend for some things such as:
All of a sudden, the “Sexiest Job of The 21st Century” sounds like it will take a century just to acquire the skills for the job.

Time is the most essential thing we have in life. Referring back to the list I mentioned above, many people start to turn away from learning Data Science because they do not have the time to learning everything.

This is 100% understandable. Most people who are interested in learning about Data Science are not able to just step away from life for a few months to a year to learn all of these complex topics. I was one of those people with the same issues, but then COVID-19 came.

COVID-19 has forced many of us (including myself) into stay at home situations, leaving many people out of work. At first, I said to myself “I should use this time of self-isolation to finally learn Data Science”.
Learning a new skill by yourself is not easy.

Learning a new skill especially right now with the current state of the world due to COVID-19 and the massive #BlackLivesMatter protests that have ignited worldwide after the horrific killing of George Floyd. This is a very difficult time to focus and learn, especially for me, as a young African American male witnessing everything that’s erupting all over social media.
Yet, after numerous attempts at trying to learn Data Science, I am now finally seeing progress, paving my own way for success in this field.
I have been on and off with attempting to learn this subject for the past two years. I have tried various MOOC’s such as DataCamp, Coursera, Codecademy, Udacity, you name it.

Although the topics taught on these websites I understood as I was learning them, I was never able to retain the information. I am not trying to discredit any of those sites at all. They are very good learning resources and many people have had success from utilizing them. I was just not one of them and needed a different approach. I would learn something, then forget how to do it the next day. It was a repetitive cycle of me completing modules, yet not feeling like I learned a thing.

Then one day, around the beginning of April, I came across a Data Science content creator named Ken Jee on YouTube. The first video of his that I watched, I remember he said that the best way to learn Data Science is by doing projects.
At that moment, a light bulb went off in my head.

I browsed to one of his playlist’s on his YouTube channel where he walked through how to tackle a Data Science project from the project planning phase, to deploying the model. I thoroughly watched through his tutorial series and recreated it as my own project. Not only did I learn things, but I was implementing them and using the concepts into a real project. By doing this, I started to retain piece by piece of what I did.
All of a sudden, things started to make sense.

While developing my first project, I stumbled across another Data Science content creator named Chanin Nantasenamat, who goes by the alias of Data Professor on his YouTube channel. He created a tutorial on how to make a Data Science portfolio website with Hugo and GitHub pages which I followed. This was a huge confidence booster because I now had a visual platform to showcase my projects as I complete them. I will link the finished product here for those who are curious on how it looks. My favorite quote from Chanin that he often states at the end of his videos is “The best way to learn Data Science is to do Data Science”.

I’m now working on my second project, planning out my third, and starting a virtual Data Analytics internship with KPMG. The reason why I wanted to write this article is because I want to share my story of how I’m starting to reach success as I am doing it now to motivate you. The world is changing at a rapid pace and rather then tell my story later in life of how I did it, I wanted to write about it currently, right now as I am working towards my goal with the message to you that it is not too late for you to begin your journey in Data Science if you haven’t already.
I will continue to document my story and progress moving forward. Please feel free to follow me and stick around to stay up to date with me and my journey.
